Sequential Component-wise Tuner for MB-sPLS

Source: R/TunerSeqMBsPLS.R
TunerSeqMBsPLS.Rd

TunerSeqMBsPLS performs sequential hyper-parameter optimisation of a multi-block sparse PLS (MB-sPLS) model in the mlr3 ecosystem. For each latent component it (i) samples block-wise sparsity vectors c, (ii) scores them via inner resampling using a correlation objective (MAC / Frobenius), (iii) refits the best candidate on the current residuals with optional permutation testing, and (iv) deflates before moving to the next component.

Construction

tuner <- TunerSeqMBsPLS$new(
  tuner              = "random_search",
  budget             = 1500L,                # iterations per component
  resampling         = rsmp("cv", folds = 3),
  parallel           = "none",
  early_stopping     = TRUE,                 # stop on non-sig. component
  n_perm             = 1000L,
  perm_alpha         = 0.05,
  performance_metric = "mac",                # or "frobenius"
  additional_task    = NULL                  # optional unlabeled task
)

Methods

$optimize(instance)

Run the sequential loop and populate the TuningInstanceSingleCrit. The optimal block-by-component sparsity matrix is returned via instance$result$learner_param_vals$c_matrix.

Super class

mlr3tuning::Tuner -> TunerSeqMBsPLS

Method new()

Construct a new TunerSeqMBsPLS.

Usage

TunerSeqMBsPLS$new(
  tuner = "random_search",
  budget = 100L,
  resampling = rsmp("cv", folds = 3),
  parallel = "none",
  early_stopping = TRUE,
  n_perm = 1000L,
  perm_alpha = 0.05,
  performance_metric = "mac",
  additional_task = NULL
)

Arguments

tuner

(character(1)) ID of a synchronous mlr3 tuner for the per-component search (e.g. "random_search", "grid_search").

budget

(integer(1)) Maximum number of candidate evaluations per component.

resampling

(mlr3::Resampling) Inner resampling strategy (default rsmp("cv", folds = 3)).

parallel

(character(1)) "none" (default) or "inner" to parallelise CV folds via future.

early_stopping

(logical(1)) If TRUE (default) run a permutation test after each LC and stop when p > perm_alpha. LC1 is always kept.

n_perm

(integer(1)) Number of permutations for the test (default 1000).

perm_alpha

(numeric(1)) Significance level for early stopping (default 0.05).

performance_metric

(character(1)) Objective used inside the inner CV: "mac" (mean absolute correlation, default) or "frobenius" (Frobenius norm of the block-score correlation matrix).

additional_task

mlr3::Task or NULL. Optional unlabelled task whose rows are appended to the inner-CV training features when extracting MB-sPLS weights. Only features are used; labels (if present) are ignored. At prediction time and for evaluation, only the original task is used.

Method set_additional_task()

(optional) setter if you want to supply it later than at construction time.

Usage

TunerSeqMBsPLS$set_additional_task(task)

Arguments

task

(mlr3::Task) The additional task to be used for tuning.

Method optimize()

Run the sequential loop and populate the supplied TuningInstanceSingleCrit. The optimal block-by-component sparsity matrix is available afterwards as $result$learner_param_vals$c_matrix.

Usage

TunerSeqMBsPLS$optimize(instance)

Arguments

instance

(mlr3tuning::TuningInstanceBatchSingleCrit)

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

TunerSeqMBsPLS$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.
